projects.title: MARKETERs Experience 2020 - Born in the Usa
projects.description:
The MARKETERs Experience is the first of three major annual events organized by the
MARKETERs Club, a nationally recognized student association and community,
which brings together marketing, communication and business enthusiasts.
This year the VIIth edition was held on Friday, December 30, Sunday, December 1, and Monday, December 3, with a completely new format: entirely online and free.
The MARKETERs Experience 2020 - Born in the USA introduced us to some of the most important American brands and delved into important topics such as sustainability and the crisis caused by Covid-19. 

The following brands and speakers were guests at the event:
Tommaso Valle, Corporate Relations and Sustainability Director of McDonald's Italia, a world-renowned American brand that has accompanied entire generations around the world continuing its constant innovation of image and entrepreneurship completely transforming our conception of Fast Food. 
Lucia Marcuzzo, Vice President North Europe of Levi Strauss & Co., considered the mother of Jeans, was founded by a German who emigrated to the U.S. in 1853. Their Jeans have accompanied periods of social revolution, from the U.S. Gold Rush to Rock music, thanks to their adaptability and everyday style. 
Rocco Cimino, Marketing Communications Manager of Ford Italia, the first automaker in the world to use the assembly line system is the third largest in the world and unique in having transformed the concept of the automobile in terms of accessibility and practicality within everyone's reach.
The event was attended by students, professionals, partner companies, and sponsors, and there were about 400 people. The making of the event was possible thanks to a task force of 15 university students who took care of online communication to the research and management of Sponsors and Media Partners.

projects.title: MARKETERs Experience 2019 - Time to Move
projects.description:
The MARKETERs Experience is the first of three major annual events organized by the
MARKETERs Club, a nationally recognized student association and community,
which brings together marketing, communication and general business enthusiasts.
Believing that sport is a fundamental factor of identity, both personal and group, the
MARKETERs Experience 2019 - Time to Move, has combined the aspects of improvement and
performance with those of team building and entertainment, both of which are also close to the future
working world of our audience.
The following brands and speakers were guests at the event:
- Davide Costanzo, marketing manager of Under Armour, an American activewear brand
that has revolutionized the sportswear industry, founding its success
in constant innovation;
- Arianna Colombari, Group Communication Manager of Tecnica Group, a leader in the
production of sportswear in the footwear and equipment market for
winter sports;
- Stefano Taboga, Head of Communication and Digital Sales at Lotto Sport Italia, an
Italian sports footwear and apparel company founded in 1973, which has always played a leading role on the
soccer and tennis fields.
A total attendance of about 350 people between club members and non-members was recorded,
partner companies and accredited figures, in an event organized by a task force of 25
university students who oversaw the logistical organization, the implementation of the
online and offline communication strategy and the management of contacts with Sponsors and Media Partners.

projects.title: MARKETERs Day 2019 -The Silk Road
projects.description:
The MARKETERs Club Venice Committee on June 21, 2019 presented the 6th MARKETERs Day.

MARKETERs Day is the third and final event the Club holds during the year. This year's edition featured emerging or widely established Eastern giants. Inserting itself into a trending topic from both the business and geopolitical worlds, the title "MARKETERs Day 2019 - The Silk Road" was chosen. 

There was a total participation of about 370 people including Club members and non-members, partner companies and accredited figures, in an event organized by a Task Force of 33 university students and 2 high school students in school-to-work alternation - assigned to the project precisely because of its high educational value.

We had the incredible opportunity to have the following brands and speakers as guests: 
- Iacopo Salemmi and Davide Lunardelli, respectively Sales Manager and Marketing Manager of Xiaomi Technology for Italy; 
- Massimo Bullo, Marketing Director Italy for Nintendo Europe;
- Andrea Colombi, Country Manager Italy for Yamaha Motor.

Those present were able to fully experience a day under the banner of the Far East, not only through the speeches of the three guest brands, but also thanks to the setting up of the San Giobbe Economic Campus, transformed to accommodate the influx of people. From the typical products served at various times of the day, such as mochi and soba, to the entertainment booths offered by Nintendo and other partner companies, the event aimed to entertain all participants to the fullest in a day of education, networking and fun.

projects.title: MARKETERs MakeIT! 2019 – Change, Save, React!
projects.description:
The MARKETERs Club, on April 12, 2019, presented the fifth edition of the MARKETERs 
MakeIT! 
With this edition, we wanted to introduce to all the participants some
companies that are investing in sustainability, giving them the opportunity to showcase the 
competitive advantages and the value that this approach manages to create in different ways. 
The guests were: 
● Fabio Zardini, Country Manager Italy at Patagonia. 
● Roberto Olivi, Public Affairs and Communication Director of BMW Italy 
● Matteo Melotti, Co-Founder of 24Bottles. 
Unlike previous editions of the event, on this occasion the 
participants did a Case Study in collaboration with the communications agency Claim Brand 
Industry this was done to show a real example and to understand how it is possible to implement CSR practices 
concretely within a company. 
Of the logistical organization of the event, which was attended by about 350 people, 
and the sourcing of the various sponsors, as well as the implementation of the 
online and offline communication, was handled by a team of 31 young 
MARKETERs, who were willing to get involved in the making of such an event for the 
duration of two months. 
This group of students made their personal skills available to the club and were able to 
actively contribute to the realization of a very successful event.
